title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 2. Regulation 44 of the Waste Water Discharge (Authorisation) Regulations
text_raw:
2. Regulation 44 of the Waste Water Discharge (Authorisation) Regulations 
2007 (S.I. No. 684 of 2007) is amended by the substitution of the following 
paragraph for paragraph (1) (amended by Regulation 5(3) of the Waste Water 
Discharge (Authorisation) (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 
2016 (S.I. No. 652 of 2016)): 

“ 
(1) Where Regulation 41, 42 or 43 applies, before making a 
decision in respect of a proposed development, a planning authority or 
An Bord Pleanála, as the case may be, shall, where the authority 
concerned or the Board consider that the proposed development may 
have a significant impact on waste water discharges, request the Agency 
in writing, within such period (ending not later than 6 weeks from the 
date of the request) as may be specified in the written request, to make 
observations in relation to the likely impact of the proposed

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend Regulation 44 of the Waste Water Discharge 
(Authorisation) Regulations 2007. This amendment is made in order to clarify 
the wording concerning the obligation on the Agency to make observations 
following a request to do so by a planning authority or An Bord Pleanála where 
they are of the view a proposed development may have a significant impact on 
waste water discharges.
